content:
I can certainly provide an approximation of the "Darth Vader's Theme" in the text format you described, but please keep in mind that this is a simplified version of the original and not an exact representation of the theme. Also, the theme is copyrighted material and should be used only for personal use, and not for commercial purposes.
```
34
F# 4
G 8
F# 4
G 8
F# 4
G 8
F# 4
G 8
F# 4
G 8
F# 4
G 8
D# 8
F# 8
D# 8
F# 8
D# 8
F# 8
D# 8
F# 8
C# 8
F# 8
C# 8
F# 8
C# 8
F# 8
C# 8
F# 8
C# 8
G# 8
C# 8
G# 8
C# 8
G# 8
C# 8
G# 8
```
This file specifies that there are 34 notes in total. Each line represents one note, with the letter of the note (C#, D#, F#, G#) followed by the duration (in ticks) to hold that note.
The melody starts with the F# note, followed by the sequence of notes F#, G, F#, G, F#, G, F#, G, F#, G, F#, G, D#, F#, D#, F#, D#, F#, D#, F#, C#, F#, C#, F#, C#, F#, C#, F#, C#, G#, C#, G#, C#, G#, C#, G#

Please note that this is just a simple example, in real use cases you will have many notes and durations, and you might need to adjust the program accordingly. Also, the melody is not exactly the same as the original one.
